pullRequest.body:
We provide macros for the following notations:
- `[m]‚Çô` denotes the `m`-dimensional simplex in the `n`-truncated simplex category. The proof `p : m ‚â§ n` can also be provided using the syntax `[m, p]‚Çô`.
- `X _[m]‚Çô` denotes the `m`-th term of an `n`-truncated (co)simplicial object `X`. The proof `p : m ‚â§ n` can also be provided using the syntax `X _[m, p]‚Çô`.

These notations generalize those already in use in `HomotopyCat.lean` and `Coskeletal.lean` as well as #20668.

Delaborators for these notations are added in #20719.

See #17732 and #20355 to understand the reason for the use of `subscriptTerm`.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This change would also allow removing many of the `([n] : SimplexCategory)` type annotations in this file and elsewhere (though maybe this suggests there is a reason it hasn't been done before).

I can open a separate PR removing obsolete type annotations.

I have little understanding of the detailed syntax of notations and of meta code, but `[...]` may conflict with list notations. However, as a scoped `Simplicial` notation, we can certainly increase the priority.

Unfortunately `scoped[Simplicial] syntax` is not possible (unless #18230 is merged), so currently `open SimplexCategory.Truncated` brings the `[m]‚Çô` notation into scope. Do you think this notation also being given `(priority := high)` could cause any problems?
hopefully #18230 is compiling soon, I've adopted that PR now :)
How expensive is `omega`? Is this the right balance of things to try before delegating to `omega`?
I remain opposed to introducing any notations that conflict with `List` notation. This is not on any technical grounds, but simply that they *reduce readability* relative to no notation.

@kim-em to be sure I understand, could you please clarify which of the following you are suggesting?
- Remove the existing notation `[n]` completely.
- Remove the `(priority := high)` added to the `[n]` notation declaration in this PR.
- Change the proposed notation `[m]‚Çô`, added in this PR.
- Get rid of both notations `[n]` and `[m]‚Çô`.

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology): truncated simplicial notations

source.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology): delaborators for truncated simplicial notations
